creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
When inserting an image, the user can change the height or width. 

Select a 1600 x 1200 image:

Change width to 160, get 120 for height as expected
Change height to 120, get 90 for width, which is wrong

creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
thanks for fixing this! i wonder: the current code uses float arithmetic, which
means we can return fractional values... should we round it to integer, just to
be sure? i don't recall having seen non-integer values in the past, but i
haven't tested that code much...

creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
Round to nearest integer in r604623. The svg module handles the float values
fine and returns integer, but might as well just round to begin with.
